rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/lib/tpl/zotero-theme/images/favicon.ico">         <title>Zotero Documentation</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/</link>         <url>http://www.zotero.org/support/lib/tpl/zotero-theme/images/favicon.ico</url>     </image>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/4.0_changelog?rev=1426722328&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-18T19:45:28-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>4.0_changelog - [Changes in 4.0.26.1 (February 21, 2015)] </title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/4.0_changelog?rev=1426722328&do=diff</link>         <description>Changes in 4.0.26.2 (March 18, 2015)  Currently released for Firefox only   *  Reopen collapsed item pane on Zotero restart   *  Interim solution until collapsed splitter is more discoverable (#678)   Changes in 4.0.26.1 (February 21, 2015)   *  Fixed saving of files in snapshots (since 4.0.26)</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/files_not_syncing?rev=1426715898&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-18T17:58:18-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>kb:files_not_syncing</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/files_not_syncing?rev=1426715898&do=diff</link>         <description>Why am I getting the message "Attached file could not be found. It may have been moved or deleted." when I try to open a file on a synced computer?  If file syncing isn't set up or working properly, files may be missing on some of your synced computers. Follow these steps to diagnose and fix the problem:</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/changes_not_syncing?rev=1426715434&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-18T17:50:34-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>kb:changes_not_syncing</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/changes_not_syncing?rev=1426715434&do=diff</link>         <description>Why aren't changes I make syncing between multiple computers and/or zotero.org?  Most likely, 1) you're looking in the wrong place, 2) the sync process hasn't completed, or 3) you've received a sync error on one of your computers.  In Zotero libraries, all existing items are shown in either the library root or the trash. Make sure you're not looking in a collection that contains only some of your items. If you don't see a group in the Zotero client, make sure \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGroup Libraries\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd is expanded in the\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v3/write_requests?rev=1426629214&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-17T17:53:34-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>dev:web_api:v3:write_requests - [Saved Search Requests] </title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v3/write_requests?rev=1426629214&do=diff</link>         <description>This page documents the write methods of the Zotero Web API. See the Basics page for basic information on accessing the API, including possible HTTP status codes not listed here.  An API key with write access to a given library is necessary to use write methods.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v3/oauth?rev=1426610284&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-17T12:38:04-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>dev:web_api:v3:oauth - [Requesting Specific Permissions] </title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v3/oauth?rev=1426610284&do=diff</link>         <description>In addition to users manually creating Zotero API keys from the zotero.org account settings, Zotero supports OAuth 1.0a for API key exchange.  Registering Your Application  In order to start using OAuth to create API keys on behalf of users, you must  to obtain a Client Key and Client Secret for use during all future OAuth handshakes between your application/website and zotero.org. Note that after you obtain an API key for a particular user these client credentials are not required for further Z\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/translators?rev=1426545976&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-16T18:46:16-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>zuphilip</dc:creator>         <title>dev:translators - [Translator Structure] xml/e4x (outdated) -> xml/dom</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/translators?rev=1426545976&do=diff</link>         <description>Translators are at the core of one of Zotero\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds most popular features: its ability to import and export item metadata from and to a variety of formats. Below we describe how translators work, and how you can write your own.  This page describes the function and structure of translators. For in-depth documentation on how to write translator code, see Coding.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/translators/coding?rev=1426324722&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-14T05:18:42-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>zuphilip</dc:creator>         <title>dev:translators:coding - [doWeb] use standard terms for attachements + pretty print coe</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/translators/coding?rev=1426324722&do=diff</link>         <description>Below we will describe how the detect* and do* functions of Zotero translators can and should be coded. If you are unfamiliar with JavaScript, make sure to check out a JavaScript tutorial to get familiar with the syntax. In addition to the information on this page, it can often be very informative to look at existing translators to see how things are done. For an incomplete summary of the main technologies, XPath and regular expressions, used in translators, see the technologies overview.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/cert_override?rev=1426275605&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-13T15:40:05-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>kb:cert_override</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/kb/cert_override?rev=1426275605&do=diff</link>         <description>Zotero Standalone does not currently provide a graphical way to whitelist self-signed certificates of WebDAV servers, as is possible in Firefox.  If you use a WebDAV server with a self-signed certificate, you can open the WebDAV URL in Firefox, accept the certificate, and then copy the cert_override.txt file from the Firefox profile directory to the Zotero Standalone profile directory, located at one of the following paths:</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/debug_output?rev=1426190456&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-12T16:00:56-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>debug_output</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/debug_output?rev=1426190456&do=diff</link>         <description>Debug Output Logging  If you've been asked to provide a Debug ID (which is different from a Report ID) to help troubleshoot a problem, follow these simple steps:  Zotero for Firefox or Zotero Standalone   *  Open the Advanced pane of the Zotero preferences. You can access the Zotero preferences from the gear  menu in the Zotero toolbar. (In Zotero for Firefox, you can also access the Zotero preferences via the Firefox preferences.)  *  Click \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdEnable\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd under Debug Output Logging.  *  Immediately p\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v3/syncing?rev=1426046259&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-10T23:57:39-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>dev:web_api:v3:syncing - [Zotero Web API Syncing] </title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v3/syncing?rev=1426046259&do=diff</link>         <description>This document outlines the recommended steps for synchronizing a Zotero Web API client with the Zotero server. Be sure you've read the write request documentation for basic information on modifying data via the API.  TODO:   *  WebSocket notifications (planned feature)</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v3/file_upload?rev=1426046251&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-10T23:57:31-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>dev:web_api:v3:file_upload - [Zotero Web API File Uploads] </title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v3/file_upload?rev=1426046251&do=diff</link>         <description>In addition to providing ways to read and write online library data, the Zotero Web API allows you to upload attachment files.  The exact process depends on whether you are adding a new attachment file or modifying an existing one and whether you are performing a full upload or uploading a binary diff.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/start?rev=1426046202&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-10T23:56:42-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>dev:web_api:start</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/start?rev=1426046202&do=diff</link>         <description>There are three versions of the Zotero Web API:   *  API Version 1  *  API Version 2  *  API Version 3 (default and recommend version)</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v2/start?rev=1426046186&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-10T23:56:26-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>dev:web_api:v2:start - [Zotero Web API (version 2)] </title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v2/start?rev=1426046186&do=diff</link>         <description>This is an old version of the Zotero Web API. For new development, use API version 3.  API Documentation   *  Read Requests  *  Write Requests  *  File Uploads  *  Syncing  *  OAuth Authentication  *  Changes from API Version 1  API Support  Please post questions regarding the Zotero API to the zotero-dev mailing list.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v3/basics?rev=1426046093&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-03-10T23:54:53-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>dstillman</dc:creator>         <title>dev:web_api:v3:basics - [Zotero Web API Documentation] </title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/dev/web_api/v3/basics?rev=1426046093&do=diff</link>         <description>The page documents read requests available in the Zotero Web API, providing read-only access to online Zotero libraries.  Base URL  The base URL for all API requests is https://api.zotero.org All requests must use HTTPS.  API Versioning  Multiple versions of the API are available, and production code should always request a specific version. This page documents API version 3, which is currently the default and recommended version.</description>     </item> </rdf:RDF>
